info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 4:16PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Greene, south central Clay and southwestern Dunklin Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 416 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Walcott, or near Crowleys Ridge State Park, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Paragould, Rector, Marmaduke, Crowleys Ridge State Park, Oak Grove Heights, Cardwell, Arbyrd, Lafe, Evening Star, Walcott, Beech Grove, Heubner, Fritz, Bard, Mounds, Halliday, Light, Leonard, Finch and Lorado. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
